examples.english: I'm going to sleep early tonight.

Do you want to order delivery instead?

examples.english: Could you recommend something popular?

examples.english: Could you check my written answer?

Let's celebrate this wonderful news!

examples.english: It seems like rain is coming soon.

examples.english: It's better to double-check important details.

examples.english: It's easier to learn through practice.

examples.english: It's harder to forget painful memories.

examples.english: I usually drink black coffee first thing.
I usually check my schedule carefully.
I usually avoid crowded public places.
I usually cook healthy meals at home.
I usually respond to emails quickly.
I always keep my important promises.
I always carry a portable charger.
I always double-check the locked door.
examples.korean: 항상 잠긴 문 두 번 확인해.

examples.english: I always appreciate honest feedback.
I always arrive at meetings early.
I never share my personal password.
I never skip my morning workout.
I never eat extremely spicy food.
examples.korean: 절대 극도로 매운 음식 안 먹어.

examples.english: I never make important decisions hastily.
examples.korean: 절대 중요한 결정 급하게 안 해.

examples.english: I never forget meaningful birthdays.
examples.korean: 절대 의미 있는 생일 안 잊어.

examples.english: I tend to overanalyze simple situations.
examples.korean: 간단한 상황 과하게 분석하는 경향이 있어.

examples.english: I tend to procrastinate on boring tasks.
I tend to prefer familiar comfortable places.
examples.korean: 익숙하고 편한 곳 선호하는 경향이 있어.

examples.english: I tend to speak too quickly sometimes.
examples.korean: 가끔 너무 빨리 말하는 경향이 있어.

examples.english: I tend to worry about unnecessary things.
I keep forgetting important appointments.
I keep making the same stupid mistake.
I keep checking my phone unconsciously.
I keep thinking about yesterday's awkward moment.
I keep buying unnecessary cute things.
I ended up staying much longer.
I ended up buying three expensive items.
examples.korean: 결국 비싼 것 세 개 사게 됐어.

examples.english: I ended up apologizing first anyway.
examples.korean: 결국 어쨌든 내가 먼저 사과하게 됐어.

examples.english: I ended up watching the entire boring series.
examples.korean: 결국 지루한 시리즈 전부 보게 됐어.

examples.english: I ended up loving the unexpected result.
examples.korean: 결국 예상 못한 결과 좋아하게 됐어.

examples.english: I stopped drinking sugary beverages.
I stopped arguing about pointless things.
examples.korean: 의미 없는 것들로 다투는 거 그만뒀어.

examples.english: I stopped using unnecessary plastic bags.
I stopped comparing myself to others.
I stopped checking social media constantly.

examples.english: No matter how difficult, don't give up.
No matter how tired, I finish my work.
No matter how expensive, quality matters.
No matter how busy, I call my mom.
No matter how late, I keep my promise.
Even if it's rainy, let's go hiking.
Even if it's inconvenient, it's worth trying.
Even if you fail, valuable lessons remain.
Even if it's scary, face your fear.
Even if it's uncomfortable, be honest.
Unless you hurry, you'll miss the train.
Unless you ask directly, you won't know.
Unless it's urgent, I prefer texting.
Unless the weather improves, we'll cancel.
Unless you're interested, don't force yourself.
It depends on the specific situation.
It depends on your personal preference.
It depends on the available budget.
It depends on who's making the decision.
It depends on what you really want.
examples.korean: 네가 진짜 원하는 게 뭔지에 따라 달라.

examples.english: There's no point in excessive worrying.
There's no point in blaming each other.
There's no point in pretending falsely.
There's no point in rushing carelessly.
There's no point in avoiding the obvious.
There's nothing wrong with being cautious.
There's nothing wrong with asking politely.
There's nothing wrong with taking breaks.
There's nothing wrong with changing plans.
There's nothing wrong with being different.
What if the original plan fails?
What if they don't approve officially?
What if we miss this golden opportunity?
What if the unexpected situation happens?
What if I make an embarrassing mistake?
I wish I could speak fluent English.
examples.korean: 유창한 영어 할 수 있으면 좋겠어.

examples.english: I wish I could visit more frequently.
examples.korean: 더 자주 방문할 수 있으면 좋겠어.

examples.english: I wish I could understand complex jokes.
examples.korean: 복잡한 농담 이해할 수 있으면 좋겠어.

examples.english: I wish I could travel more freely.
examples.korean: 더 자유롭게 여행할 수 있으면 좋겠어.

examples.english: I wish I could express myself better.
examples.korean: 나를 더 잘 표현할 수 있으면 좋겠어.
